One of the core ideas is to transform the objective that needs to be controlled into an intervention vector and to regulate the LLMâ€™s output behavior by multiplying it with a controllable magnitude during the forward propagation.
Figure 2:Visual depiction of diverse scenarios in EasyEdit2 for intervening in LLM behaviors.

Figure 3:The overall architecture of EasyEdit2.
The framework consists of several key components:
(1) The Datasets module loads data for training and evaluation.
(2) The Methods module includes steering vector generator (e.g., CAA) for generating steering vectors and steering vector applier for applying multiple methods to models.
(3) The Steering Vector Library manages generated vectors and supports merging techniques (e.g., TIES).
(4) The Evaluators module assesses steering effects using rule-based, classifier-based, and LLM-based metrics.
The entire pipeline enables controlled and flexible model steering.
Figure 4:A code snippet in EasyEdit2, where the CAA method shifts output language from English to Chinese.
